summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from June-July 2020 regarding a request for assistance with a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails are between FBI agents in New York and another field office (TD), coordinating logistics and access for the review.

persons.name: SA Young
persons.context: Identified as the case agent for the Epstein investigation, and the one requesting assistance for a taint review.

connections.description: SA Young sends a request for taint review assistance to M, indicating they work together in the FBI's New York Field Office on the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial Taint Review Request
events.description: SA Young sends an email requesting assistance from M for a taint review related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination for CART Overview
events.description: Agents coordinate a meeting and a trip to CART (likely Computer Analysis and Response Team) to get an overview, indicating active logistical planning for the review.

locations: 26 Fed (likely referring to 26 Federal Plaza, NYC FBI Field Office)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively conducting a 'taint review' in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of June-July 2020, indicating ongoing investigative work after Epstein's death.
The review was considered a 'unique opportunity to work on a high profile investigation' and required special security access (CAIR account, 'high side' access).
The correspondence shows internal FBI coordination between the New York Field Office (Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking) and another field office (TD) for personnel assistance.
The document references logistical details like NADP training, CAIR accounts, and CART, highlighting the technical and procedural aspects of the investigation.
